Pre-Game Insights: Canada head into the tournament as favourites
Bermuda is the second-best team and are basically the main competition
Others: Canada have never been to a T20 World Cup

Bermuda’s players stayed on home soil to prepare when taking part in the Bermuda Premier League, Canada’s players were picking up experience in the Global T20 Canada before the team headed off to the United States for some competitive matches
Canada captain Saad Zafar is Pakistani-born
The tournament takes place in the United States and the West Indies next year
Canada are eyeing an historic maiden appearance when the tournament takes place in the United States and the West Indies next year
Zafar is well aware of the importance of the first game of the tournament when his team takes on Bermuda at White Hill Field tomorrow
Zafar is targeting huge wins in the qualifier
The last time Canada made it to a World Cup was 12 years ago in the 50-overs World Cup in 2011
It’s each individual player’s dream to play and represent Canada in the World Cup and this is a great opportunity that has been presented to us
We’re coming off our season back home, where everybody was playing club cricket, so everybody was in good touch
We had a pre-tour in Houston as well and we were there for ten days to play some good, competitive cricket
Houston was quite hot and we’re coming to the end of our season in Toronto, where the weather has got a little chilly

We were able to play some games against clubs as cricket is growing in the US and there are a lot of clubs that have brought in professional players all over the world, including India, Pakistan and South Africa
We pretty much played against teams with ex-IPL players, which I believe will have us prepare for this tournament
